review: Red Robin is definitely "Yummm".  There aren't too many locations near Atlanta, so this was a treat to find one on our way to hike in North Georgia.  The menu is a little daunting. They offer just about everything you can imagine. But this place is known for their burgers and bottomless fries, so just focus there and ignore everything else.  I got the Royal Red Robin, which had an over-easy egg on top...the kind of egg that when you bite down, the yolk oozes out and down the burger. Yeah, it's pretty incredible.  Drinks are SUPER EXPENSIVE. Holy cow, $2.99 for a soft drink is kind of ridiculous!!  Get water and save some change.  Service here was great.  Everyone from the host to our server was very nice and helpful.  To top it off, it was my birthday, so my burger was free. You have to sign up for their rewards program to get it, but it's worth it.

I used to regularly frequent this restaurant because I love the burgers and the concept of bottomless sides. But the last two visits have been thoroughly disappointing. At one of my visits my broccoli side had some sort of white web inside. I should have taken a picture of it at the time, but I was too alarmed. I called the waitress over, and she took it to the manager. He came over and told me that the broccoli was SUPPOSED to have black ends and that he didn't see any bug or white web. I eat a lot of vegetables (I know you're thinking who in the world would order bottomless broccoli), and I previously would order the broccoli here and I am sure it is not supposed to turn black or have a white-webbed creature in its midst. They gave me a coupon for a free appetizer for my next visit. I waited a few months before coming again because it was hard to get over the image of the browning broccoli and cocooned critter. I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt and maybe they just ran out of fresh broccoli that day. Their burgers are normally pretty fabulous, so I wanted to try them again. I ordered the pretzel bites (with the free coupon), and they were not anything special. The cheese dip it came with was unimpressive. I ordered the Banzai (one of my favorites) with the onion roll bun. The flavoring in the burger itself was wonderful as always, but the bun wasn't cooked long enough so I was disappointed. And of course I made the tragic mistake of ordering bottomless broccoli again. It was browning at the tops and ends again (although thankfully I did not discover any white webs). I told the waitress the broccoli was old and asked for fries instead. I have resigned to the fact that they will disappoint. For such a well-known franchise, I think they should take better care to uphold a better quality of food so as not to embarrass the rest of the chain. If you're looking to eat some tasty burgers and binge on steak fries then this may still be a good restaurant for you. But if you are interested in being certain this is a clean restaurant with fresh produce then you may want to reconsider.

Great burger cooked just right, wife had chili bowl and enjoyed it. She said it was a little hot for her but good otherwise.  Great prices on draft beer 16 oz size is just right. Server was great and very attentive to our needs as he was also covering many other tables at The same time.  Had a surprise visitor as our granddaughter and her boyfriend got seated right behind us.  Will be back looking forward to it.

Not bad but not great. Our uncle wanted to go so we went. It was our first time here. We got the special which is one of 3 burgers with bottomless fries for 6.99. It's not a bad deal but the hamburger is just slightly better than McDonalds. The atmosphere was cool and they serve liquor/beer. If I go back, I think I'll try a gourmet burger. Service was fast and efficient!

Their burger was pretty good, but nothing super wowing in any aspects. The gals at the front and bar were super friendly so I presume service is pretty on point.  I went in for a to-go order bc I had a birthday coupon so use. Psst. Sign up for their rewards program, and you can get a free burger. Yes, a whole free burger.  Anyway, I ordered the wedgie burger. It was sort of messy to eat bc lettuce replaced the reg old buns. The guacamole just seemed to spill from all sides of this thing. The burger's seasoning was pretty flavorful and good. Your burger order comes with a side (fries or a salad) or you can upgrade for a small up-charge.

WE'RE BACK!!!!!! 5 years ago we stopped visiting our local Red Robin in Cranberry Twp Pa because of poor poor service.  Food was good but employees were rude and inefficient. While visiting in Georgia this week our Grandchildren insisted on Red Robin for dinner.  I dreaded it but.... Wow was I surprised.  There were 8 of us and our waitress handled us efficiently.  Our food was delivered without incident and quickly.  Even the spills were cleaned up quickly.  Our main server was  Gabby. Try the  Smoky Pepper Cheddar burger.  YUM.  And the size of the "mini" wedge salads will amaze you. Good job!

Don't know why I eat here. Yes I do, the wife makes me. I thought red lobster was supposed to be full of calories. I look at them on the menu and think ignorance would be better. That way you don't see you are going to end up with a full days calories in one meal.  Thank you bottomless fries and no self control. Here I am in Atlanta and the air is blowing at me and it is cold. They tell me Colorado controls the air. That's one long arm.  The food. It's alright judging by the bar clients, beer and bottomless fries are a big draw. I ain't skinny, but I can say that I am dwarfed by a significant number of people you don't want to sit next to on the plane.  Hmm. Got a free burger on the wife's rewards. She must be sneaking here without me.

VEGETARIANS and VEGANS SHOULD AVOID THIS PLACE! I ate here for the first time 11/11/17 I ordered a veggie burger and had leftovers. I decided to have the rest of my burger for a midnight snack. When I lifted the top bun, there was fish and something else fried under my top bun. I feel sick and angry! If they don't make this right, I'm taking further action!

First time here, I have eaten at Red Robin before. But not at this location.  Our waitress was Johnny on the spot. The food is fantastic. Red Robin has the best burgers period. The onion rings are fantastic with the campfire sauce. We will be back. Yum.

Had a free burger coupon so we took advantage of it. Sat in the bar area at a high top. It was not very busy but the service was slow as the bartender was also waiting tables. The food was par for a chain burger place. It's hard to complain about a "free" burger but the bun looked like it had been smooshed. Go figure.  But to RR's credit, their bottomless fries are really good. They are steak-fry style, crisp outside and light golden brown with great potato flavor. But I had to send back the first batch - luke warm. The manager corrected that and they disappeared quickly.

First time here. Had the BBQ WHISKEY CHEESE BURGER.  With bottomless garlic fries. Burger was good. Had flavor. Fries was soggy. But had good flavor. Shaevonne. Was our server and she was great. Always smiling and very attentive.

I am a fan of Red Robin's however, this location was extremely below my expectations and the sad part about the situation is it wasn't during rush hour , it wasn't busy at all . The food was cold , the fries were Burt smh ... I will never return to this location ...

Went to Red Robin today and my fried cod was overcooked. Aaron our waiter was very kind and asked if he could have it remade, I declined. Then the manager came over and apologized and offered to get me something else. I actually filled up on the fries and didn't want to wait for something else. The reason I gave 5 stars was because both the manager and waiter were so kind and concerned. I didn't ask but the meal was taken off my bill. The customer service here is excellent and much appreciated! My son said he really enjoyed his burger, one of the best he has had!

Went two days in a row with our family of 6 because our first experience was so great. Great, attentive server, food was served hot and fast. The 2nd experience was VERY poor. Waitress had an attitude from the start. Unprofessional, talking over me while I was giving my order, being very short, rolling her eyes at us, etc. Told the manager and he was great. Then the food came out AND GUESS WHAT........... IT WAS COLD!  I immediately spoke to the manager and he was great. He comp'd our entire meal and apologized profusely. He even had the food cooked again.  But the server was terrible. She is obviously in the wrong profession and I hope she find happiness doing something else............. like driving a long haul truck so she doesn't have to interact with anyone! We won't be back.

Burgers are consistently average--not bad not great. The signature endless basket of fries is always one of the main reasons to come. The onion rings are tasty, nice batter and crunch. The batter can slip off sometimes though. The fried pickles are always scrumptious. The wings are actually well done! I didn't like the sauce, but it has a nice thin crisp layer and a tender juicy inside, it is surprisingly well cooked.  The atmosphere and décor makes it a fun place for family to come to. Red Robin for some reason is just one of those places we find ourselves craving every now and then. Whatever they're doing, it certainly works. It must be the endless fries--genius. Service is always good considering how busy they can be.

Went for lunch on a weekday and was pretty quiet.  Decent service and burgers were ok too. The burgers are a bit small compared to other places but definitely seemed less oily. The onion ring tower was pretty good.

Burgers are top notch and salads are equally as tasty. Service is good and the bottomless strawberry lemonades hit the spot every time. Perfect after movie spot for the family to enjoy good food and family fun.

I had always wanted to come to RR and finally I was able to make it. Arrive at the location, wich was fairly busy Sunday afternoon, and we where seated very quickly. Waiter came to our table in an instant. Super friendly lady, sadly I forgot her name. She was very patient with us (I liked all the burguers in the menu) and finally we decided to order. To my surprise, the order came back really quickly! The burguer was donw perfectly (and the sweet potatoes fries too). My friend didn't have no complain either from their burguers. In the end, I love my experience with RR! Must go!!!!

I used to love this place but there has been a steady decline in the service, food and yeah, the prices have gone up! There are so many places I'd rather go to get a burger, that this place would be almost the last on my list at this point.  There is nothing particularly unique or special about the food, atmosphere or location that would really make me want to go there.

This is my favorite place to eat. I have the exact same thing every time...a Burnin' Love Burger, fries, garlic aeoli, and freckled lemonade. I have loved going to Red Robin since I lived in Boise in 2000. The atmosphere is great, top notch service, and the food is consistently good. If they lowered the price on beverages, I would give them 5 stars. $5 is a little pricey for lemonade.

Had the regular cheeseburger and sweet potatoes fries.  The hamburger was good, and the fries as well.  First time here, however I will not drive all the way to Cummings from Marietta again just to have a meal here.  The server Shevonne was excellent, came by several times to check on us and had a smile on her face.

We've eaten here many times since it opened. It's been consistently good and no complaints. It's pricey for a burger, you know that going in. Most recently my favorite item is the turkey burger, wedge style. The turkey is moist and flavorful. You don't miss the bun at all! At our recent visit the service was great and we had a good experience. We'll continue coming back!

We have been to Red Robin three times since they opened at Buford Mall and the service is the worst they sit you and you have to wait up to 10 minutes for  somebody to take your drink order then takes about 10 min to get your drinks after we got our drinks the waiter left without taking our orders we finally just walked out not going back

What's not to like!? Beer, burgers and onion ring towers! The staff is good and the atmosphere is pleasant. It's good to have a hamburger joint that is not like the other guys! (Example: five guys)   I will continue to comeback to this place.

As there are few Red Robins around Atlanta, I was excited to visit when we ended up at a soccer game near this location. We had a very sweet waitor but he was not on his game, or just sucked. From ordering 3 drinks (all waters) and shakes and not getting that right I should have known it wasn't going to be good. Only the chicken fingers came out right. Without sauce, but right.  I am not sure why waiters love trying to remember things, but writing things down does not make you any less of a waiter. In fact, in my book, it only makes you better. I appreciate you taking the time to make sure what you bring me is what I ordered. Repeat it back to me to verify? Even better! But once you get past our server, the food was not worth the money. I try to separate the service and food since one can just be a bad egg, but not in this case. The kids burger was gross, the other food was just ok. The milkshakes were good but not the best. I'd prob choose chickfila over RR, but I am a chickfila addict so that may just be me. I love fry seasoning so that's a plus. Overall left with a bad taste in my mouth. Will not be returning anytime soon.

Great place to eat! My mother has been wanting to try this place for the last couple of years. I decided to surprise her and have dinner here one night. First impression, we were greeted at the door immediately. I guess the hostess could tell it was our first time here so she went out of her way to explain everything and cater to us. She gave recommendations and my party of 7 did not hold back on the orders and drink refills! My mother is 71, and slightly a pain in the butt? So when orders were placed on the table and hers didn't come out on the first round she complained out loud to herself. Lol! The waitress heard her apparently and came back with her order and apologizes to is with free appetizer coupons. The hostess and waitress repeatedly came back to see if everything was alright. The food was good and I totally recommend the orange crime soda! Overall a great experience and great food. Can't beat that'

The dining area has been remodeled, huge plus.  The chairs and environment is much better. The Berserker X burger was lackluster, overloaded with aioli, and an overcooked patty.  The garlic parmesan fries were soft and swimming with what I assume was olive oil.  The best part of the meal was the root beer float, yum.

Since opening this location has been hit and miss when it comes to service. For the most part the managers treat customers like they are a bother.  The food is mostly consistent, no complaints there. It is THE only reason to go back.  Tonight was no exception to the crummy lack of care shown by the staff, lead by poor management.  The place was unkept. Floors filthy from food on the floor. Pulled out my chair to find it dirty and wet. I tried to make eye contact with the staff. A manager looked at me with what I would describe as disgust and shook his head. I ended up dragging the chair over and exchanging it for a clean on along the wall.  Once seated he came by and rudely said you could not wait?  I responded, shut up. He yelled get out of my restaurant. I refused to go. He went to another manager and was very animated in his conversation. We stayed. The food was fine, but this guy kept standing around tossing dirty looks.  Nice job Red Robin. How about training your managers on how to deal with situations better?

FIRST IMPRESSIONS REVIEW* Always wanted to try a Red Robin, but this one did NOT meet expectations for quality burgers at a reasonable price... Lost 1st star - Running a giant burger restaurant on a busy Sunday night with about 1/3 of recommended wait staff. Lost 2nd star - Charging $9 (to start) for a burger featuring a previously frozen beef patty. Lost 3rd star - Barely cooked frozen steak fries -- just 'cause they're unlimited doesn't mean you ration them. Lost 4th star - Ridiculously tiny booths in the age of fat Americans. Will I be back? - UNLIKELY Should you go? - PROBABLY NOT * - First impressions reviews are my way of visiting a place once and getting a feel for it. The full review comes later.
I love onion rings, but I have to launch a complaint about the new decor. It's extremely lacking in tasteful nudes of Seinfeld characters above the bathrooms.

I love Red Robin, ever since I lived in California, it's fabulous! Definitely a must-try! If you like burgers, chicken burgers, wraps, salads, chicken fingers, and BOTTOMLESS fries, with garlic seasoning, bottomless/unlimited, and the ranch, oh the ranch, it's FRESH and made in-house. You want to try this place. Staff is friendly, there is a Pokémon Go Stop AND amazing food. If you are of age, try the bar. They have a large variety of beer and fabulous mixed drinks.

Haven't been to Red Robin in a while. Burger patty seems a bit thinner than the last time I ate here, but it was still good. The waitress forgot our pretzel bites, but brought baskets of fries along with the drinks. The chocolate truffle sticks were brought to the table frozen solid as a rock. My husband and I weren't impressed, although they came highly recommended from a friend.

This is usually our favorite family dinner spot. Our last visit was horrible- kids food was cold and dry, burgers were burnt, and we were there over an hour and a half. (Restaurant was half full during our dining)  The restaurant was VERY dirty. We were seated at a dirty table. I asked the waitress to wipe our table and she used her hand to wipe the crumbs on the floor.

This place is okay for burgers and a cheap meal if you have a family. Endless French fries with any meal. The burgers are pretty good but for price, I prefer going to Five Guys or Burger 21 (pay a little more but oh my devious). Not really my favorite and would probably not go back unless I had kids

Placed a to go order tonight and specifically asked for no onions on an order because of an allergy, the box even had no onions written on it but the food was covered in onions. Also my second order said no mayonnaise and the only condiment on the burger was mayonnaise! Not happy about this....

Tried Red Robin again and had an equally disappointing experience. When the waitress seated us with a smile, she asked what I wanted to drink. When I asked for water instead of an alcoholic beverage, I guess our party of two instantly became unappealing to her. From that moment on, her attitude changed, barely giving us the time of day and even trying to rush us. In the middle of placing our order, the waitress stopped me and walked off to have a laugh with another server that was throwing things at her from behind. Later, when she dropped off our meals, she walked off before I could look anything over or asking if we needed anything else--literally dropped the plates and ran. I paged the waitress using the electronic device on the table, but she never returned or acknowledged us until it was time for the bill--I had to ask another passing waiter for the item missing from our meal. My son ordered freckled fruit salad--not a single strawberry in it. Bottomless fries? Nope, not today. My son also wanted a shake to go, so I placed the order through the electronic device at the table. The waitress returned, instructing me to go ahead and pay through the device, once again not asking if we needed anything else or even if we were satisfied. I asked about the shake we ordered and she looked stunned and ran off to get it, quickly returning to try to hurry us from her table again. Unreal experience. On top of this, the table was sticky and the overall cleanliness of restaurant was just plain nasty. When a nine-year-old boy makes a statement that "McDonalds is cleaner than that place," you got a BIG problem. The food was OK, definitely not worth the hype nor the price. One of the worst restaurant experiences I've had in a long time, and definitely the last time I'm going there.

I grew up on the west coast, so Red Robin was pretty much part of my life growing up. I have a lot of fond memories there with family and friends across Alaska, Washington and Oregon.  Not surprisingly, I was pretty excited when the Red Robin showed up in Georgia right near our home. One of the only ones here.  Unfortunately, this Red Robin is like seeing your first love from high school after 15 years and they've gotten fat, lost their teeth, and generally lost any semblance of what you loved about them in the first place.  Having been here several times*, my experience has been exactly the same: The service is generally slow and inattentive, the food much below what you would/should expect, and the entire meal is just plain not good.  It's like the corporate HQ forgot they had a restaurant here and so there is little accountability or even desire for the local management to more than the min to get by. It makes me sad to write this review but I have no other choice. Hopefully someone reads this and steps up their game. I hope so, because my family would love to come back. But it's highly doubtful.  *ive been several times for the same reason I've been several times to McDonald's: Because I want it to be good and forget how bad it is until I eat them meal, and realize what a terrible mistake I've made.

Had the Royal Burger (bacon cheeseburger with an egg on top) on a GF bun.  That's a good option to have these days. GF. They have GF for their burgers, entrees and drinks too. Win win! The only reason I gave it a 4* is due to the fact that I paid $11 for a burger and my bun was hard and dry. I understand GF is difficult to work with. But, I shouldn't have received a dry hard bun.  Other than that, the order was perfect, everyone that got the seafood platter, raced about it. My son loved his corn dogs. Just my boyfriend and I. We didn't like the GF buns. It was a bummer.

Usually, this is one of my favorite restaurants.   Tonight,  however,  it was pretty bad.   My fries were COLD, not just not hot enough,  and my chicken tenders weren't particularly warm,  either.   My shrimp was just ok.   They usually do better,  but tonight they were pretty bad.

2.5 stars middle of the road. Burger food-ok, $/4 pricewise, service - quick prompt and perfunctory, typical franchise red robin decor  What can I say about a place that charges from$10+ for a burger. It's close to the avenues so gets busy. Good place to take the kids as it really appeals to kids and always a fav of sports team after party.  Had the boneless wings- good, ring tower-wanted to try it and it was ok, guac burger $11 - it was good but NOT mouth watering amazing, Mac and cheese-kids like it, spring chicken burger with sweet potatoe fries- good- liked the sweet potatoe fries.  Would recommend and will be back as this is one of the favs for the kids.
The DGB is EVERYTHING!! It's always busy but the food is consistently good. The floats are good as well as the deserts. Kids loved the table tablet games.

Came  back with my mom a few weeks ago and was quite surprised at how mismanaged this place is. We came on a Sunday, after lunch around 2- hoping all would be clean after church and ready to go. What a mess!!! Nearly 20 tables dirty, floors we couldn't even walk on that were sticky, full of trash- and all the wait staff just stepped over it knowing it needed to be picked up. Got a new waiter that was - odd- did' know the menu, and was clearly out of his league. But my mom loves the onion rings and the burgers! So we are coming agin on memorial day- she's craving it- and if they are not up to par- we won't be back. This has great potential- but management needs a burning bush under their ass if they expect this place to survive. Its in a prime location, a good bar, all the makings for a top notch place. If it was mine- It would be a goldmine of service, clean, attentive and listen to your reviews. Let's see what happens on Memorial Day. A special day for mom. IF they ruin it, I'll spill the beans more on reasons we saw NOT to come. If its good- I'll commend mgt for getting their act together...
I love this place! I come here at least once a month and get the BBQ chicken wrap and fries... delicious! The bottomless fries are the best! Service is always great too, great atmosphere.

Nice casual atmosphere, although a bit noisy.    I liked the decor.  Now, I don't go out to eat burgers because that is just silly to me.  My husband loves to go out and eat burgers frequently so this time I thought that I would give it  a go.  Nothing on the menu interested me and I was not going to order, anything, ( no big deal, I do this often) , but he started to get nervous and said that we would leave so I quickly ordered from the kiddie menu because I knew that he was hungry.  Of course I did not care for the burger.  I prefer a turkey burger, breast meat, topped with tomatoes, onions, avocado, cucumbers, lettuce  and a splash of white balsamic vinegar.  Now, I know that I am only going to get this custom burger by making it myself.  I also know that it will be prepared with clean hands and to my exact specifications.  So this is why I don't frequent burger joints.  I also don't understand why their  burgers are considered gourmet burgers.  They were actually very plain to me.  My husband is a repeat customer, but when I questioned price vs product vs what he typically gets at home, he suddenly lost his appetite and said that he would not be returning to the Robin.   Know BEFORE you go. Update 7/30/15  As of this date, my husband has not returned to the Robin and continues to enjoy his wife's deliciously awesome burgers at home! :)

I went in an hour and fifteen minutes before closing, there was no hostess but I caught the attention of an employee who told me I could seat myself in the bar. I sat down at a table and waited, I browsed the interactive screen while I waited and click the call server button. 10 minutes passed with no service, the bartender helped other customers, saw the request for service and decided her dirty dishes were more important than waiting on a customer. I was very disappointed with my experience as I had been looking forward to a burger. This was horrible service and I left without another employee talking to me even though a couple passed me while I was waiting and as I left.

I recommend getting the garlic Parmesan fries (usually endless?) and also (if you're 21) get the Guinness milkshake. I'm not the biggest fan of Guinness beer to be honest, but this milkshake for some reason is super good. It's incredible.

I have been here multiple times and am aware of the over priced burgers. However I always did enjoy the burgers here. My issue is the service which only seems to get worse as time goes by.  Visited this location after watching a movie at the AMC around 9:30 PM on a Saturday.  It took over 45 mins to get our order although there were only 2 other parties in the restaurant.  My son's kid's meal was delivered with fries at room temperature and none of us had silverware at our table.  The staff was more focused on cleaning up before closing for the day.  When the waitress did realize that the silverware was missing she brought some that we couldn't use anyway due to the assortment of stains on the knives.  Next time I feel like eating a burger I'm going to Five Guys. Less expensive and better quality there.
I love Red Robin. Great value and always delicious! I usually get takeout. I haven't had a bad burger yet. Always get medium well and you are guaranteed medium. Yummy onion rings.

I've only tried the burnin' love burger and fries so I can't speak for the rest of the burgers, but I'm a fan! The burnin' love burger is a delicious burger that is topped with fried jalapeño coins, tangy salsa, pepper-jack cheese, tomatoes and chipotle aioli. Their burgers are served with bottomless steak fries which is a nice perk. Be sure to sign up for their red robin royalty card! You get great deals like a free burger during your birthday month. Who doesn't like free meals?

Use to be one of our favorite places to eat. However the quality of food and service has steady declined over the 6 months. During or last visit we had to wait 30 minutes for drinks and what seemed like an eternity for our meal.  Not only did the meal come out wrong but it was also cold. Had to send it back twice for them to get it right and management acted as if I was an inconvenience to their busy day. Seriously is it that hard to make a basic bacon cheese burger?? Even after waiting an eternity for cold incorrect food and having to send it back twice management never offered to take the burger, which was not eaten, off the check. At least my dog enjoyed it...and it only took 15 mins to get a to go box. Too many other restaurants around to treat your customers poorly and allow your quality of food to go downhill.

First visit this location.  Sunday afternoon and the place was packed, but no waiting at the moment.  Server greeted us and seated us at a table and our drinks and order was taken.  Only short wait and the burgers were delicious!!  Rate 5 of 5.

After a so-so experience a few months ago I decided to try this again with my young boys last night.  It was dreadful.  Service was slow and the food is very overpriced for the quality.  In addition the AC vent was blowing cold air the entire time to the point where my 11yr old had to move to the other side of the table to share a seat with his brother.  Never saw the waitress after the food came, paid the bill on the electronic table thing.  With all the options in the area I will never go back..

We have eaten at this Red Robin location quite a few times. The burgers are always great, the shakes are good - I love their Red Screaming Zombie and they actually know how to make it! I always get funny looks when I want the bottomless broccoli and they typically bring me fries instead, which is annoying. Though, they're not receiving five stars because SOME of their servers can be - for lack of a better word - "spacey." I wish I could remember the name of the server we had before today's visit so we could ask for her section. It was awesome seeing the staff in Halloween costumes today! I also love being able to pay at the table via touchscreen when using a card! We will return!

This is a nice place to grab a burger with a friend/family member, and chill for a bit. This location is not too big, and not too small; making for a cozy dining experience. My order of a burger and fries filled me up, and my father and I's food was brought out promptly. To my knowledge, I am pretty sure that they have free refills on fries. If you like burgers-at a decent price-this will be a convenient place to grab one.
Christina was the best waitress and the food was so amazing. I got a root beer float, nacho burger, and my son desert and everything was perfect! Thanks Red Robin. Yum....
Great burgers and beers. But didn't have everything on tap that the menu said they did.

Red Robin is probably thee most attractive burger joint anywhere. The decor is outstanding, but I wish the taste of the food matched.  When they first came to town and open their doors off Web Gin House Rd in Snellville, it was amazing. It marked the first time I'd ever had a burger with a fried egg on top. I fell DEEP in love when they introduced endless steak cut garlic fries... but after a little time went by, it seems the food became less and less satisfying.  Got a coupon on Facebook ($5 off) and thought I'd give them a try. After all, it's been a few years. To my delight they had Patty Melts on the menu, but to my disappointment it was not as flavorful as I hoped.  *The Patty Melt was average. If I had a wish list it would be for a better seasoned burger patty, rye bread that tastes like rye (which this bread did not) and fries that aren't visibly dripping with grease. I also prefer grated Parmesan cheese on the fries instead of stringy shaved (like I received today).  *The Clam Chowder was good, but I used to think it was great (back when they first opened). *The fried mushrooms were ok, I would have liked them cooked a tad bit longer, but not bad.  Overall, I love the look of this place, but don't have the same love for the food. It's not a bad restaurant, but for the price of food here, I can think of several places I'd rather go. NOTE to guys who love redheads w/green eyes: They have a girl working here that looks exactly like Emma Stone.

Awesome service, awesome burger. Went with party of 6 and got seated right away. Hostess hooked us up with drinks. Waitress followed and ordered a round of 6 burgers few different sides. Everything came out great. Cheese on burgers perfectly melted. Service throughout was really exceptional. Definitely a go-to place.

Stopped by on Sunday, but since there was a wait we decided to get an order to go. We both had the Cheeseburger and Fries, mine with cheddar and hers with swiss. It took our order about a reasonable wait of 15 minutes. Once in the car, we started eating the fries. They were good and seasoned well but could be described as warm at best. The burgers were also warm at best. The burgers did not have any seasoning and you tasted more of the onion than the burger. I expected a lot more from a gourmet burger. Don't plan on going back anytime soon.
We really enjoy eating here. The variety on the menu offers something for everyone but the burgers are definitely the main feature. I like to get the Bonzai on a veggie burger - it's amazing!

I'm not a huge fan of chain restaurants but red robin is one that I do enjoy. This particular restaurant is really good and Sally is a great waitress! Super friendly and down to earth. She made the eating experience just a little bit more fun. Make sure to ask for her.
They've mastered the guinness, despite having the beer in various bars this is the best one I've had. Other than that the burgers and sides were just ok and takes a long time.

I've been to several different Red Robins in different states. The menu itself is fairly standard, as is the food. What sets this location apart is the wait staff. From the hostess to our waitress to the person that brought out parts of our order, everyone was friendly, attentive and smiling. The waitress especially was great-she came by periodically to check everything was okay without being intrusive. (I hate when your wait person walks up to ask "is everything okay or can I get you anything else" just when you have a mouthful of food.) They were extremely busy for a Saturday afternoon at 3pm but we only waited about ten minutes. The food came out quickly and was hot. I'll definitely go back.

My first time visiting Red Robin in Cumming was a couple of weeks ago.  I don't think I'd ever stepped foot in a Red Robin before but I could be wrong about that, because I tend to confuse this chain with Johnny Rockets. It was Valentine's Day and we had tickets for Die Hard.  Rather than fight other miserable couples for service at a "nice" restaurant before the movie, we opted for this place because we figured that a greasy burger joint is not exactly a romantic destination.  We were correct.  However, it does appear to be an after school destination for Forsyth's preteen population. The interior is surprisingly spacious and clean.  There is kitschy stuff strewn about like road signs, odd art and a miniature Statue of Liberty that greets you at the door.  There is also a small arcade area with video games adjacent to the entrance, and more importantly, a full bar.  I wasn't aware that they served alcohol at these places but they'll whip up a boozy shake for you if that's what your heart desires. Our server was very attentive.  That's important because they served my Diet Coke in the smallest possible glass which was also crammed full of ice.  Just a few sips from that thing and it was drained.  But the server was so on her game that I never went thirsty, even though that meant bringing at least four refills.  She never complained or rolled her eyes once. I ordered a cheeseburger with a fried egg on it, because that is the best way to order a burger.  Instead of asking how I wanted the meat cooked, she asked me if I wanted "pink or no pink".  This concerned me a bit but I understand the need to standardize the cooking process at these fast-casual chains.  Fortunately my "pink" burger was delivered to the table at a perfect medium.  My preference is medium-rare, but it was honestly very well cooked and flavorful so I can't complain too much.  The egg was also fried to perfection.  It was a damn tasty burger and much better than I had anticipated. Burgers at Red Robin come with bottomless fries.  You can keep ordering fries until your gut bursts.  That's a nice option, but these aren't fries that would make me want to order multiple baskets.  They are massive steak fries covered with a lip-puckering coating of salt.  You can opt for sweet potato fries at a $1.50 upcharge, but frankly they are just as salty and not worth the cost in my opinion.  Stick to the regular fries and limit yourself to one portion for the best experience. Red Robin pleasantly surprised me.  Well cooked burgers, fast and friendly service, and reasonable prices.  Plus booze.  That's a winning combination.

If I could give this red Robin no stars I would. Our fries were greasy and cold, they didn't have half of our order so we had to wait. Our drinks were watered down and tasted as if were mixed with tap water. The manager offered dessert on her for the inconvenience, only she gave us one slice of cheese cake for  a party of three. I will simply scratch red Robin my short list of restaurants. So disappointed

Really great burgers here! they are cooked to order and are very tasty. The menu is extensive with lots of neat burger options. The inside of the restaurant is eye pleasing and they have some TVs on the sides as well. I will say that the service was a little slow and our server came around only a few times during our meal. Over all, the floors were clean and the staff was courteous. I recommend this location. 4/5
Great food and burgers.   Large selection of burgers.     Service is a little slow but over all not bad
Great place for a fun burger lunch. The many (many, many) burger options give you plenty to choose from. Enjoy!

Hey, guess what - it's a chain burger!!  That being said, food is pretty up to par for being a chain. As is service. As is parking.  Our waiter was nice, but the place was busy, he managed to check in a few times, but nothing too outstanding... Then again, IT'S A CHAIN.  Come in, get a burger, just don't expect to leave raving about the expereince. It is what it is.

This RR has a couple of things really going for it : - Consistently great service - Consistently great food My family and I really enjoy the burgers, shakes, and drinks.  Like the majority of the restaurants in the Avenues, this RR is very convenient to eat at before a movie or to stop by while shopping.
Slow service. Super packed. And bottomless fries are not actually bottomless. Takes to long to get them for them to actually be bottomless.

Went to this RR recently with a buddy to try out the Sam Adams promo items (mainly the Milk Shake). We were not let down. First, our server was fantastic. We were filming our escapades, and she was very friendly and fun. She also kept our drinks filled and our Sam Adams mustard and cheese topped off. Much appreciated! The Sam Adams shake is outstanding. Try it. Thank me later. you won't be let down. Also, the Sam Adams burger was really good. The Oktoberfest flavor fills both of these items and really gives you that great flavor you are looking for.  As for the rest of the restaurant, we honestly didn't pay attention. We were on a mission, and that mission was fulfilled. It was easy to park. I just wish there was a closer location to us.

Our favourite at Red Robin is the Burning Love burger .. They can customize it any way you want .. you can even make it a burning love fish sandwich or a vegan sandwich.. substitute the fries with the onion rings which are real good. For the kids, mac n cheese or pizza are recommended.

In complete honesty, the only reason I go here is for the Bruschetta Chicken sandwich.  I have driven from Grant Park to Cumming for that thing.  The bottomless fries (with the delicious seasoning salt) and the onion ring tower are just a bonus.   I can't comment on anything else on the menu because I've never tried anything else.  I can say that this place is mostly just your stereotypical chain restaurant.  There is one ridiculously, amazingly outstanding waiter that works here though.  So that's awesome.  So, all I can say is, if you're looking for the best chicken sandwich you've ever had, come here.  For anything else, I'm sure there are better options.

I used to eat here as a child in California...they've upped their game big time! Delicious turkey burger, I added onion straws to it. The cibatta bread just sets it apart from most burger joints. It's soft not hard at all. The cro-nuts are amzing. Great texture and they come out warm. I wish they had a glaze or more sugar dusted on top. They did however serve them with raspberry and chocolate syrup dipping sauce. I will be back!
Great food every time! Except once I had a hair in my appetizer basil chip dip. That made me a bit sick.

First off, terrible service. One of the worst services I have ever had. Second, my burger came out raw when I ordered it well done. The table behind us of sent there burger back as well. They kindly took it back and made me a new one. The manager came to the table behind us and offered them a free burger. He never visited us to do the same or to even offer an apology. A burger place should know how to cook a WELL DONE burger. We will never be back..

Service was a tad slow to start but the manager came over and took our order. That was nice. We were short of time at lunch and needed to hurry. Excited about the meal. The guacamole bacon burger is awesome. Fun atmosphere. Good parking. Just could use a tad more hustle. No issues at all with dinner. Might just not be the best lunch place if you are on a a tight schedule.

Great burgers and the endless fries are great. The service was outstanding and I truly enjoyed the the look and feel of tge restaurant. The okly complaint I have is that the drinks seemed a little light on the alcohol, we each had to have our drinks remade but it was done without any hassle.  I will definitely go back.

So, went here before going to the movies. First choice was Chick Fil A, but way too crowded. The service was a bit slow but good. My son and myself ordered Dr. Pepper's.  It was basically a 2 liter drink. My son ordered a Bacon cheeseburger and I ordered the soup and salad (House salad and French onion soup).  While waiting on our meals my son played on the table computer.  Our meals come out.  My sons burger looked good, but for $10.99 hardly any fries.  Mine on the other hand, looked like they opened a bag of lettuce and threw day old veggies on it.  The French onion soup was horrible!  The onions were not  Caramelized or cooked and the broth had no flavor.  I actually had to add salt and no red wine taste at all. Might I add this was $10.  So instead of a check I was told to go through the table computer.  Then the tip was given at 20% for lunch, when typically it should be 15% for lunch I  could have changed it, but did not.  Our waitress was good.  Then after the machine printed out my bill we were charged $2 for an entertainment fee?  What the hell is this?  Because my son played a game on the table computer? Needless to say, the bill was $30 for lunch after the tip.  We will NOT be back. Boo Ya!

We went there this evening for some "gourmet" burgers as their advertising touts.  When we got there - 5:30pm on a Sunday - we had a 15 minute wait.  I think they were short servers as I only counted 4 for the entire place.  Yes, they have numerous toppings and choices but frankly we were all disappointed with the food.  Overall quality was average at best....certainly NOT gourmet.  The burgers are just a little over cheap bar food but well below a decent burger joint.  If you have eaten at The Habit in Southern California (Redondo Beach / Torrance actually) you know a good burger...Red Robin is no where near that.  We buy the grass fed ground beef from Whole Foods and make MUCH better burgers at home. Will we go back?  Probably not.  Three burgers, the chicken and shrimp plate, 4 soft drinks, mudd pie and tip was $80.  NOT a deal at all considering what we got.  Go if you want to but be aware that it probably will hit well under your expectations.

First time at this restaurant and I tried the bonzai burger. Consisted of teriyaki soaked patty with pineapple slice & cheddar, it was delicious! The kids enjoyed the atmosphere and never ending steak fries. My burger cost around $10 and there were plenty other varieties both higher and lower. They also have a vegan substitute and other things besides burgers if that's not your cup o tea. The service was great! Our waitress was very patient and prompt with refills for drinks and fries.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the condition of the table. The tables have leaflets when turned up changed the table from square to round to accommodate more seating. The support for the leaflets had seen better days and created a slope to the edge of the table. More inconvenient than anything, but overall great place and great food! Will definitely return.
Food is alright. But service is very slow.  Had to wait 17 mins to place an order then another 32 mins to get the food. This was on a Sunday night

I have always enjoyed eating at RR. I've been to one in CA, one in OH, one in FL & 2 of the locations here in GA. This last trip (to this location) was the best one yet as far as service. We had an awesome waitress! I will def make sure to ask for her when we next visit for my hubby's b'day. I will say that we started with the sweet potato fries & they left a good bit to be desired. We actually had a free voucher for them.  I wouldn't pay for them, based on how they tasted. They were room-temp at best, not too tasty & came with an odd dipping sauce. Our burgers were good as always. I think the steak fries seemed a bit less yummy than they used to be. Not quite as hot, not seasoned at all (they do provide seasoning salt on the table, tho), and didn't seem quite as fresh & soft as they used to.  I sure hope the quality of RR isn't going downhill (based on reviews I've read of this location & the Lawrenceville one).  Boo-hiss if so!  They've always been one of my favorite burger places since I discovered them about 8 years ago. But based on the service we got this time, I know we'll be back.  And I always love, love the Whiskey River BBQ burger.   But if anyone at RR is actually reading these reviews, please don't go down in quality like some other chains I know & used to like much better (hello Zaxby's anyone?)......

I have to agree with a few of the other reviewers: Having been to Red Robin locations pretty much all over the country, I figured this one would be about the same quality & dining experience. Not even close. I rarely blast a place in my reviews, but this Red Robin is R-U-F-F rough. We (wife, daughter, & I) went on a Saturday around 4 pm - they were about 1/2 full (1/2 empty?), and we sat immediately. The server clearly did not want to be there, and she treated us like we were distracting her from something. After a VERY mediocre burger & fries basket, we sat at the table for 10-15 minutes, obviously waiting for a check, when the server stopped by & asked if we wanted any more fries. Maybe 20 minutes ago, yes. But now we wanted to leave. I asked for a check, and she told me I had to pay using the wireless tablet at our table. I'm not a fan of identity theft, so I asked if she could run it at the register, which she - politely -  declined to do. Won't be back.

Raw bacon+Wrong order+Meh food= Plenty of other places to get a great burger.  When looking for a great burger. it is the burger that attracts me and NOT the bottomless fries. The service we got was pretty good, but it did not overshadow the problems from the kitchen. Half of our party had to return their meal due to inaccuracy. The wrong orders were removed from the tab, but the experience had already been ruined.. To be rated Zagat's Best Burger, it is still lacking...

Had the Prime Chophouse burger today and it was just okay, nothing to write home about. IMO there is no comparison to Cheeseburger Bobby's. Though Red Robin in Cumming is much nicer, I don't go to RR to eat the decor. In summary, I'll take a burger from Cheeseburger Bobby's over RR any day.

I've been here a few times, mostly because my children are big fans of the mac and cheese.  That's where the fandom ends in this family.  The food overall is fairly average and it's very obvious the restaurant has a portion control strategy. The burgers are on the smaller side and the sides are squeezed into tiny side dishes.  What stuck in my craw the most is the $1.99 "entertainment fee".  Beware.  There is zero information that there is a charge for the kid friendly electronic device conveniently placed on the table.  The service, at least today was flat out poor. During my meal, the server completely forgot my hummus appetizer and never came by for a drink refill.  I also need to mention that upon arrival the two hostesses showed no effort at being hosts. One had her head down in the seat map and the other had her head in some type of tablet device used by the restaurant.  Terrible introduction.  No greeting, no smile. No nothing.  I had to introduce myself and almost blurted out "Hello!" to get their attention, even though I was standing directly in front of them.

Used to be a terrific place to eat but over the last 6 months the food and service have deteriorated to the point of counting in off of our list of places to eat. Service has gone from very good to Poor with teenagers more worried about texting and gossiping with other servers than getting the order correct. Managers that walk around letting the restaurant be run by servers who have no idea how to be friendly or accurate. The food has gone from delicious to what the hell happened to the best burgers in town.

Food is decent but I can't figure out why these sort of places always put snarky girls at the hostess stand. Stare at me with no expression and say, "How many kids' menus." Well, how about look at us and see that we have two kids. It's not that hard to be friendly, but it seems to be a job requirement for the girls at the front to be anything but.

Went tonight with my girlfriend to get a bite to eat. Just an appetizer and a dessert. We got the "Mountain High Mudd Pie", which is a HUGE amount of ice cream, at least five scoops worth, to my estimation. Not to mention the whipped cream and tasty caramel. Easily worth the $7 Our appetizer, which was also $7, was the "Cheeseburger Con Queso", a " zesty cheese dip with fresh ground beef, topped with salsa and fresh cilantro". It was VERY disappointing. The dip was bland, and the chips a bit stale. I've had much better queso at other restaurants for half the price. Now, you may be saying "if the queso is so bad, why are you giving them a five-star review?" Well, I let our waiter know about the quality of the queso, and the manager came out, apologized, and took it off our check! If that's not great service, I don't know what is. I've enjoyed the food at RR for a while and will continue to do so! Keep it up guys!

I've never eaten at Red Robin before and when i saw the sign on the side of the 400 I knew I wanted to try it.   There was no wait on this Sunday afternoon.  The place is much larger than I expected.  The server was very nice and attentive.  We each had a burger and fries.  We both agreed that the burger was very good, not dry, and cooked exactly as ordered.   I wished there was one closer Atlanta.  If I go back up 400 I know where I'm eating.   The place is kinda noisey with the crowd and the children but with an establishment this size it was to be expected.

I used to go to the Red Robin in Boston all the time and when I noticed they have 1 at the Avenue I had to check it out and was glad I did...  Yes I know i tend to not normally like the typical chain style restaurant but Red Robin to me is a fun place with usually great friendly staff and reliably good food and thats how it was here...  The new Chili Queso was so good and I had the Chili which was nice and spicy... Everyone enjoyed their meals and we left feeling stuff.. The Never Ending Drinks and Fries are a nice touch but I wouldn't recommend eating here all the time unless you wanna be a fatty...  But for the once and a while splurge this place is worth it....

Great for lunch.  Good burger, fries, beers. Kinda pricey.   i remember these guys from OC in So Cal.   They're good-very good.  But I'll take a star off because of the price and I'm running out of stars.

Either get it right, or don't do it! If you can't ensure that the bun that is delivered to the table is gluten free then don't have a gluten free menu. My son has celiacs disease and we eat at places that cater to a gluten free diet. My son even questioned the waitress about the bun being gluten free since it tasted too good. We were assured it was. It clearly wasn't. Not only does it make him sick it damages his body. Work on your procedures or delete the menu.

I went back to Red Robin, "DUMBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB!!!!" I have visited this location a few times and each time was progressively worse, and each time I swore not to return. I tried to turn the other cheek in a restaurant kind of way, and give them another chance, but this time, I SWEAR I will not go back! Service was the worst ever. I had my 2.5 kids with me and we hadn't seen the food for thirty minutes, so i asked for fries to hold them over. They never came. The food finally came out and the fries were cold. I asked for fresh fries. They never came.We had no ketchup at the table, I asked for ketchup, or catsup, or anything red. Finally I asked a neighboring table for the coveted tomato sauce. In fairness, when the waitress brought the check she did manage to say "Oh you wanted ketchup", so she didn't completely forget, just forgot to bring it while we were eating the cold fries. Food was, and is always average at best. Sandwiches are never as good as they sound on the menu, or look in the pictures. I appreciate the vegetarian options, but they are both commercial, either a MorningStar Farms Veggie Burger or a BOCA Original Vegan Burger. Between the two, I prefer the BOCA. These can be subbed for all their regular burger options. While we were there I saw two different tables ask to speak to the manager, and not to rave about the food or complement the service. I would hate to be the manager there and have to defend mediocrity all day. The only thing worse would be to have to eat there again.

My first time here and I had high expectations, but it just wasn't anything special. It seemed busy, but we were seated fairly quickly. Waitress was friendly and very nice, however, it took forever to be served. We were seated close to the kitchen, but had to get up to find someone to refill drinks.

My kids love this place. Always crowded but good family atmosphere. Have a decent selection of salads that my wife loves because they are gluten free and she can eat without a problem. If you dont like kids dont come here. Red Robin YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM wife likes, kids like I like 5 stars for a hamburger joint

Good food, horrible service. Love the veggie burger option, wonderful for vegetarians. The endless fries are such a deal. The lack of service is reason enough for us to take our business elsewhere. Great for kids and a quick but fun bite to eat.
Best Burgers n Atlanta, love the Banzai burger with pineapple and terriyaki sauce and the burning burger, fried jalapenos just take it over the top.
A good place too eat  they have great food and I guaranteed there is something here for every one and amazing service !!!

Not near the top if my list anyway but table anchored too close, shoe sticking to the floor like there's gum, and pulling a French fry + a hair out of my mouth just added to the whole experience. And once again one more Cumming restaurant to cross off the list.  Blech.

The place looks like a chain, smells like a chain, even sounds like a chain. As with any other chain, it's bright and it's loud. Really loud. With a bevy of over-eager teen-aged servers. My order of choice was obviously a burger, seeing that it's their specialty. There are quite a few burger choices on the menu but I settled for a cheeseburger since it's easier to compare with other burgers. Burgers here come in two temperatures: "pink or no pink"; which is their chain speak for your preferred doneness. They also come with bottomless steak fries. The burger was meh. In fact, I wanted to shout, "where's the beef?" I could not taste the beef at all with the large amount of toppings. First of all, the beef patty was tiny and the buns were huge and tasteless. Then, it didn't help that it also had a whole handful of shredded lettuce, two huge slices of tomatoes, 2 slices of cheese, 7 onion rounds, 4 big pickle slices, and 3 teaspoons of mayo.  It's like eating a salad sandwich. And although the steak fries were steaming hot, they were limp and bland. For around $10 I prefer to go to Five Guys where I can get 4 burgers which are far more superior in taste and quality.

Sure, you can get all kinds of burger toppings here, fancy limeaids, bottomless steak fries. But after three visits, the burgers never got better than fair in quality and taste, and the service was spotty and inexperienced. Not worth the price.

They are always so friendly there and who can resist unlimited fries? They have a number of tasty sounding choices but I couldn't resist the jalapeno loaded Burnin' Love burger plus it appeals to my love of Elvis. Fried jalapeño rings, tangy salsa and spicy Pepper-Jack cheese layered on top of a cayenne-seasoned and served on a jalapeño-cornmeal kaiser roll with chipotle mayo. It certainly sounds like it is going to be a 4 alarm fire in your mouth of taste but it is more like a burning trashcan that you can throw a splash of water on. It is tasty but it didn't even make me take a sip of my water. It's as if the jalapenos had all been homogenized down to pale shadows of their former glory. Probably it is so that the burger can appeal to a wider audience of eaters afraid of spicy foods.
Their burgers and onion rings are awesome. And also I love the atmosphere and all the decorations thy have on the walls.

I've been back to Red Robin about half a dozen times since they opened. Still overflowing crowds. Best to go before traditional lunch or dinner hours. They also have a pretty good birthday promotion. Register on their website, put in your DOB. They will email you a $3 coupon right away. Then on your birthday you get a free burger. Not bad. The downside to their recent success... I think their prices are going up. Cokes at $2.39, yikes!

We came for dinner and had the Caprice chicken sandwich and California chicken sandwich with unlimited fries. Both were very tasty and from the reviews it would seem to be a good alternative to the burgers. Service was good and fast and nice ambiance. Good experience

When I saw the sign in front of the soon to open Red Robin at the Avenue of Forsyth, I thought, "Thank You, one of my Favorite places has resurrected from the dead!" All I can say is where's the Red Robin I grew up with? This place has turned into a low rent kiddie Circus; I don't know if they're trying to mimic a Northeastern Greek Diner, a Chuckie Cheese, or a Sonic with indoor service! All I know is that the food has become mediocre yet demanding a premium price; NOT a combo worth returning to! I miss the Red Robin of years ago!

The burgers are good. Not great, but a decent burger. They have several options and unique burgers. They serve salads, chicken sandwiches, GREAT milkshakes and other items. We love their Tower on onion rings, it is under the appetizers. It is very family friendly. They always have cartoons playing on some of the televisions.

From what I've heard from others, people either really like or really despise this place. I fall into the latter half. Rarely has a restaurant meal made me feel so ill. There wasn't enough warmth in my burger to melt the cheese on it. It had the taste and consistency of a frozen entree from the supermarket. My son didn't like his food either and didn't finish his meal. Food has to be pretty bad to spoil the palate of a ten year old. Our meal left me nauseated for hours afterward.

While on vacation in Georgia, my family and I decided to have lunch at RR. Who could deny the bottomless fries, right? Out of seven of us, five of us had chicken plates. The other two had burgers. We ate, we drank, we paid, we left. The next day, all five of us that had the chicken plates all had food poisoning. Mine was the worst. Stomach pains persisted for 6 days for me while the other four were just a few days. The worst part is that we had to catch our flight back to Ca with food poisoning. It was the longest flight ever!!! We called the restaurant to complain. The person who answered asked if we were part of the business group that got sick. HUH??? You mean there were others???? We called corporate RR. They were apologetic and reversed the charges. However, they were negligent in providing any concrete information in HOW they were going to rectify what happened. They said they were in touch with the Dept of Health (suuure!!!!). I will be complaining with the DOH as well. I will NEVER eat at an RR. They can keep their bottomless fries too!
I am a big RR fan. Fast Service, Good Food, reasonable prices! Great place to bring the whole family. Good menu for small children. A lot of variety, I love the Ensenada chicken.

Visited on the early side of lunch.  Ordered bacon cheeseburger, took a few bites and realized that the bacon was raw.  Pointed it out to the server who took the plate away.  Instead of a new burger, she brought out the same burger (I could tell since it was missing the few bites).  The cook removed the raw bacon, cooked it and put it back on the same burger.  When the server came by again and noticed that I hadn't touched the burger, I pointed out that the burger had raw bacon on it and could make me sick.  She mentioned that the cook had done this a few times that week!  Yuck!

What started out to be an easygoing attempt to have a burger at a different place became complex. Let's get the easy part over with: The 'Banzai Burger' was surprisingly tasty with a slice of pineapple and teriyaki sauce topping a lean beef patty, lettuce, and other goodies. It was served half wrapped in paper to prevent burger juices from anointing one's shirt front. Unfortunately, the protection didn't work, and I got to wear a teri stain on my shirt for the remainder of the evening. The steak fries were large, hot, and soft, which is OK, not a killer thing for me. Things got complex when we were pretty much 'processed' like herd animals to a booth, "Hi, I'm Kissy (not real name), welcome to Red Robin, what's for drinks, I'll be right back, here y'go, what're your dining choices this evening (zip)." Now, I don't expect servers to fawn over me and make like my new best friend either, but when all the waitstaff are walking around like racewalkers while the neon lights, noise, and loud colors are vying for attention, dining restfully becomes difficult because there's this frenetic pace to 'sit, order, eat, pay, leave." The price for two burgers and drinks, fries included, was $30.00 with tip. Just a little over the top for me, but, hey, the joint was packed, so what do I know?

This was our second time dining at the Red Robin. It is the first time going there with a kid. Overall the experience was positive. We were there at an off hour (2pm on a Friday). The service was friendly and attentive. I got the French onion soup and a salad. The soup was above average, a standard beefy, oniony broth with a nice crusty cheese layer on top.  The bread they used could have been better but it won't stop me from ordering the soup again. My salad was mixed greens with some cheese, tomatoes and cucumbers. They have a decent dressing selection. I got the Asian sesame which wad good. The husband got some sort of smoke house BBQ with fried onion burger. The report was that it was great. What really stands out at the RR are the onion rings. They are huge and perfect. If you are tasting for the perfect onion ring look no further. Skip the campfire sauce; we found it to be pretty ho-hum. Eating at RR is a great choice for kid-friendly dining. They give out balloons. For a 10 month old, that is key.

We ate there last night, we had a blast!.   Service was above par (thanks to Logan) and the food was excellent.  They certainly have energy and  vibrancy, the entire staff seem to enjoy themselves.  Somewhat pricey for a burger joint but we had the current specials (new items) for $5.99 which worked for our group.  That allowed our teenager and her friend to get the huge-mongous rootbeer floats without breaking our budget.  Bottomless drinks, great but I opted for water and my wife and I shared a pomegranate tea. Bottomless Fries too but I don't need the carbs. They had a Rockin Red Robin walking around the restaurant high fiving and fist bumping literally everyone.  The 13 year olds were mortified when I told the big bird my wife was "with child" and couldn't participate, I just couldn't handle the thought of the germ fest happening on the Red Robin's wings.  Sure, it's a kids place but I would eat there without them, the food was good.  They are liberal with handing out discount cards and you get coupons if you join there E-Club, also a free burger on your birthday!   So the question I have to ask myself is would I pay $10 for a burger at Red Robin?  Not willingly but we had fun and the kids loved it ...!!

I LOVE hamburgers so, my family and I ventured 20 min+ to get to this restaurant for my birthday dinner. I figured if they specialize in burgers they have to be good, right? Wrong!! The amt. of meat on the burger was the same as you would get at a fast food restaurant (flat and not juicy and tasteless)--but the price was almost $10 per burger? My kids'burgers looked like they were eating at mcdonalds they were so small and boring. My son had heartburn afterwards (only 5 yrs. old) and my mother complained of heartburn later in the night. The fries might be bottomless, but they are BORING--no flavor at all--I had to pour malt vinegar and salt on them to make them taste good. And the service was quite slow . . . it took forever to get our order in and it was an unbusy wed. night. So dissapointed that I wasted my hamburger calories on this place. Burgers at chili's, outback, cheeseburger bobby's and fudruckers are so much more worth it!! I can't believe they can charge that much for a MCDonald's style burger!
